a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Change in old-age dependency ratio, 1950 to 2023
The number of elderly people (over 64 years old) relative to the number of working-age people (15-64 years).
Figures are shown as the number of dependents per 100 working-age people. A value of 20% means that there
are 20 people of old age for every 100 working-age people.

path.id: outline__Age dependency ratio, old (% of working-age population)

text.tspan: Data source: UN, World Population Prospects (2024)
